alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 9:55AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Much Colder Temperatures, Wind, and Snow on the Way... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Patchy freezing drizzle, below normal temperatures, gusty north wind 15 to 30 mph, and eventual snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Northern Johnson County, including Buffalo. * WHEN...Colder air filters into the region along with gusty north wind. Areas of freezing drizzle gradually dissipate Wednesday afternoon. Light snow arrives later tonight and persists through Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wednesday temperatures hover in the upper 20s, and gusty north wind increases during the afternoon. The snow is likely to be heaviest between 6AM and 3PM Thursday. Thursday highs only climb into the upper 20s.
